intro: Thelymitra uniflora, commonly known as the single-flowered sun-orchid, is a striking member of the Orchidaceae family native to southeastern Australia. It is characterized by its vivid orange or yellow flowers, which are typically solitary and borne on erect, leafy stems. The plant thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands or heathlands. Its unique floral structure includes a spurred lip and a distinctive column, typical of many orchid species. Thelymitra uniflora is a perennial herb that blooms during the summer months, adding a splash of color to its natural habitat.
